intro: Malvastrum aretioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers bloom from summer to autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Malvastrum aretioides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
